intro: Schwenkfelda umbellata, commonly known as the white hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its large, waxy, white to pale green leaves that are often lobed or divided. The plant produces an inflorescence called an umbel, which consists of small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late spring. Schwenkfelda umbellata is adapted to moist, shaded environments and is often found in rich woodland soils. It is noted for its ornamental value and has been used historically for its medicinal properties.
